intro: Hieracium seticollum, commonly known as the narrow-stem hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It prefers moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
